required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of GORE® SYNECOR Biomaterial in Focused Patient Populations and Long-Term Application
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of GORE® SYNECOR Biomaterial in Focused Patient Populations and Long-Term Application

brief_summary.textblock:
The SYN 20-01 Study is a non-interventional, prospective, multicenter, multicohort, international, post-market clinical investigation looking into the assessment of GORE® SYNECOR Biomaterial in focused patient populations and in long-term application.
Patients with ventral / incisional hernia amenable to hernia mesh repair will be enrolled into two cohorts (US and EU cohort) and followed-up over the period of 60 months.

secondary_outcome.description: Major Seroma as clinically assessed (physiological parameters) and defined as seroma requiring treatment in the presence of infection, recurrence, mesh rejection or the need to be punctured/aspirated will be described without specific hypothesis or formal goal. Number of subjects with reported major seroma will be described as clinically confirmed by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life (QoL) - SF 36 Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: SF 36 Questionnaire (36-Item Short Form Survey Instrument; possible score ranges from 0 to 100 points. 0 points represent the greatest possible limitation of health, while 100 points represent the absence of health restrictions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life (QoL) - Carolinas Comfort Scale (CCS)
secondary_outcome.description: Carolinas Comfort Scale (CCS); CCS was designed that a lower score indicates a favorable health status; the total score is based on a scale of 0 - 115)

secondary_outcome.measure: Ventral Hernia Recurrence Inventory sensitivity / specificity within 60 Month Follow-Up
Adverse Events by Clavien Dindo Classification
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse Events by Clavien Dindo Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgical Site Occurrences (SSOPI) requiring Procedural Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Surgical Site Occurrences (SSOPI) requiring Procedural Intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgical Site Occurrences (SSOPI) requiring Procedural Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Surgical Site Occurrences (SSOPI) requiring Procedural Intervention

arm_group.description: Hernia mesh repair with GORE® SYNECOR Intraperitoneal Biomaterial
Hernia mesh repair with GORE® SYNECOR Preperitoneal Biomaterial

intervention.description: Hernia repair with GORE® SYNECOR Biomaterial; technical approach laparoscopic, robotic or open surgical / minimally invasive surgery

study_pop.textblock: The SYN 20-01 study population will consist of patients who present with ventral/incisional hernia disease requiring treatment per the evaluating physician. Eligible study subjects need to be amenable to treatment with a permanent synthetic mesh as suggested by the inclusion and exclusion criteria for each study cohort.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria - IP Cohort:
- De-Novo ventral/incisional hernia amenable to repair with GORE® SYNECOR IP Biomaterial
- Clean wound (CDC Wound Class I)
- mVHWG Grade 1 or 2 (modified Ventral Hernia Working Group)
Key Exclusion Criteria - IP Cohort:
- Wound is either clean-contaminated, contaminated or dirty-infected
Key Inclusion Criteria - PRE Cohort:
- De-novo ventral/incisional hernia, with subject anatomy and surgical plan is amenable to open surgical repair or minimally invasive surgery with the GORE® SYNECOR PRE Biomaterial placed in a sublay fashion within the preperitoneal space
- Clean wound (CDC Wound Class I)
- mVHWG Grade 1 or 2 (modified Ventral Hernia Working Group)
Key Exclusion Criteria - PRE Cohort:
- Wound is either clean-contaminated, contaminated or dirty-infected
